title: 2 Quick Ways to Connect PS4 Controller to PC + Fixes

steps.title: Turn the controller off.
steps.content: Turn the controller off. If the light indicator is on, the controller is already on and connected to a different device. To turn it off, press and hold the PS button until the light turns off.

steps.title: Open your computer's Bluetooth settings.
steps.content: Open your computer's Bluetooth settings. Click the Start menu and type "bluetooth and other devices settings". Click the first option. You can also click the Start menu, click the cog icon, and then click Devices .

steps.title: Toggle on "Bluetooth".
steps.content: Toggle on "Bluetooth". The switch will turn blue. If you don't have Bluetooth capabilities, you'll need to use a wired connection instead.

steps.title: Click Add Bluetooth or other device.
steps.content: Click Add Bluetooth or other device . This is at the top of the window. On Windows 11, click Add device . A new menu will open.

steps.title: Click Bluetooth.
steps.content: Click Bluetooth . This is the first option. Your PC will enter syncing mode.

steps.title: On your controller, press the SHARE button and PS Button.
steps.content: On your controller, press the SHARE button and PS Button. Hold both buttons down at the same time until the light bar flashes. It will then start to blink while in syncing mode. [1] X Research source

steps.title: On your computer, click your device.
steps.content: On your computer, click your device. The PS4 controller should come up as Wireless Controller . When it connects successfully, you'll see Your device is ready to go! in the window.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done . This will close the window. Your controller is ready to be used with your computer. To remove your controller from your PC, open the Bluetooth settings again. Click your controller in the list of devices, and then click Remove device . If your controller isn't connecting, see the next section to use a wired connection instead, or try to troubleshoot your Bluetooth.

steps.title: Connect the USB end to your computer.
steps.content: Connect the USB end to your computer. To use a wired connection with your PS4 controller, you'll need a micro USB to USB cable. If you don't have the wire it came with, make sure to get a replacement from PlayStation. Some third-party cables may not be compatible with the controller.

steps.title: Connect the other end to your controller.
steps.content: Connect the other end to your controller. Make sure it's flush to the controller.

steps.title: On your controller, press the PS button.
steps.content: On your controller, press the PS button. The controller will turn on. You can now use your controller with your computer.

steps.title: Charge your PS4 controller if it won't connect to the computer.
steps.content: Charge your PS4 controller if it won't connect to the computer. A PS4 controller takes about 2 to 2.5 hours to fully charge . If you can't connect the controller to your computer, allow the controller to 100%, and then try pairing it again. If your controller isn't charging , check your cable, outlet, and charging source.

steps.title: Toggle Bluetooth on and off.
steps.content: Toggle Bluetooth on and off. If your PS4 controller isn't connecting to the PC, switch your Bluetooth off, and then turn it back on. This can fix minor connectivity issues.

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer. If the controller won't connect or it doesn't appear in the list of Bluetooth devices, the issue may be with your computer rather than the controller. A quick restart can fix common problems.

steps.title: Use a different cable.
steps.content: Use a different cable. The cable you're using to connect the controller to your PC may be damaged or incompatible. Purchase a replacement cable directly from Sony, or use a different cable.
